SEARCH

Class ECPoint

java.lang.Object
ECPoint
public class ECPoint extends Object
Class representing points on the Ed448-Goldilocks elliptic curve. Supports creation of points given their x- and y-coordinates or their y-coordinate and least significant bit of x. Also provides functions for computing a point's opposite, comparing points for equality, addition of points, and scalar multiplication of a point.
Version:
1.1
Author:
JJ Coldiron (ecoldi@uw.edu)

      public ECPoint(BigInteger y, boolean lsbX)
      Constructor for a point on the Ed448-Goldilocks curve given the y-coordinate and the least significant bit of the x-coordinate.
      Parameters:
      y - Y-coordinate of the point.
      lsbX - Least significant bit of the point's x-value (1 = true, 0 = false).

    • solve

      public static BigInteger solve(BigInteger y, boolean lsb)
      Solves for x given y and the least significant bit of x.
      Parameters:
      y - The y-coordinate of the point.
      lsb - The least significant bit of x.
      Returns:
      The corresponding x-value.

    • sqrt

      private static BigInteger sqrt(BigInteger v, boolean lsb)
      Compute a square root of v mod p with a specified least-significant bit if such a root exists. Adapted from Prof. Paulo Barreto's project specifications.
      Parameters:
      v - The radicand.
      lsb - Desired least significant bit (1 = true, 0 = false).
      Returns:
      A square root r of v mod p with r mod 2 = 1 iff lsb = true if such a root exists, otherwise null.
